snippet: People born outside the former “one child” limit are stateless inhabitants of their own country — without the identity documents, rights and services that usually come with citizenship.
abstract: Chinese who were born in violation of country's longstanding one child law wonder if policy change will bring them better life; additional children have existed in secretive, stateless limbo, deprived of identification papers, health care, education and other benefits.

byline.contributor: Edward Wong contributed reporting. Owen Guo contributed research.

lead_paragraph: People born outside the former “one child” limit are stateless inhabitants of their own country — without the identity documents, rights and services that usually come with citizenship.

headline.main: In One-Child China, Second Children Often Live in Limbo
headline.print_headline: In One-Child China, Second Children, ‘Outside Plan,’ Often Live in Limbo
